intro: Schiedeella esquintlensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian Schiedea, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Schiedeella esquintlensis is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
